alert.note: Alert for Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 9:46PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Tangipahoa, northern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and Walthall Counties through 1030 PM CST... At 945 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Salem to near Franklinton. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklinton, Tylertown, Varnado, Salem, Dexter and Angie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.
